means: 李维(Titus Livius,59。B.C.-AD.17，罗马历史学家)
[女子名] 莉维 Olive,Olivia的昵称

sentence.Network_en: I'm broke, Livy, and I owe a couple of million dollars.
sentence.Network_cn: 我破产了，莉薇，而且我欠了几百万美元的债。

sentence.Network_en: He looked at Livy and Mark, who had risen to greet him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看着站起来跟他打招呼的莉薇和马克。

sentence.Network_en: Livy ate the pasties greedily and with huge enjoyment.
sentence.Network_cn: 莉薇津津有味地大口吃着点心。

means.word_mean: 1. Roman historian whose history of Rome filled 142 volumes (of which only 35 survive) including the earliest history of the war with Hannibal (59 BC to AD 17)

auth_sentence.content: He is a connoisseur of ancient battles; whenever he makes a film, he takes along Livy's history of the Second Punic War.
